tasks.title: Implement Database Schema Extensions
tasks.description: Extend the existing Supabase schema to support new study space features by integrating with current tables and relationships.
tasks.details: Update and extend the existing Supabase schema to enable study space features, ensuring integration with current tables such as profiles, base_classes, lessons, lesson_sections, and related entities. Instead of creating isolated new tables, design extensions that build on and relate to the existing database structure. This may include adding new columns, foreign keys, or join tables to support features like study space notes, bookmarks, mind maps, sessions, AI conversations, and content interactions. Use declarative schema management and migrations to ensure consistency and maintainability across environments[2][3]. Avoid creating redundant or siloed tables; all extensions should enhance and connect with the current schema.
tasks.testStrategy: Run schema validation scripts and test CRUD operations on each new and extended table, ensuring all new relationships and integrations with existing tables function as intended. Validate that migrations apply cleanly and that data integrity is maintained.

<info added on 2025-07-13T15:58:43.591Z>
Based on the comprehensive analysis of the Student Study Space PRD and the current Supabase schema, the following detailed requirements have been gathered for all new features necessitating database schema extensions:

NEW TABLES REQUIRED:

1. student_study_spaces: Individual study space configurations per student per course, with key fields including student_id (→profiles), base_class_id (→base_classes), name, description, settings (JSONB), and timestamps. Establish many-to-one relationships with profiles and base_classes.

2. study_space_notes: Student-generated notes supporting rich content and content linking, with fields for study_space_id, title, content (JSONB for rich text), content_references (JSONB for linked content), tags (TEXT[]), and timestamps. Features include multimedia support, automatic content linking, and AI-enhanced organization.

3. study_space_bookmarks: Saved content references across lessons, sections, and media assets, with fields for study_space_id, content_type (lesson/section/media/etc), content_id (UUID), notes, and timestamps. Supports polymorphic relationships to various content types.

4. study_space_mind_maps: Generated and custom mind maps adapted from teacher tools, with fields for study_space_id, title, map_data (JSONB), is_collaborative (BOOLEAN), and timestamps. Integrates with the existing teacher mind map generator.

5. study_space_sessions: Tracks study sessions and analytics, with fields for study_space_id, session_data (JSONB), duration_minutes, content_interactions (JSONB), and timestamps. Enables analytics for learning patterns and engagement.

6. study_space_ai_conversations: Stores AI chat history and context for Luna Study Mode, with fields for study_space_id, conversation_data (JSONB), context_data (JSONB), and timestamps. Enhances Luna AI with course-specific knowledge.

7. study_space_content_interactions: Provides detailed interaction tracking for analytics, with fields for study_space_id, content_type, content_id, interaction_type, interaction_data (JSONB), and timestamps. Enables granular tracking for learning analytics.

8. study_space_collaborations (Optional for Phase 3): Supports group study features and shared spaces, with fields for study_space_id, participant_ids (UUID[]), collaboration_type, permissions (JSONB), and timestamps.

EXISTING TABLE EXTENSIONS:

profiles table additions:
- study_preferences (JSONB): Stores learning style preferences and AI interaction settings.
- study_analytics_enabled (BOOLEAN): Controls privacy for analytics.
- default_study_settings (JSONB): Default configurations for new study spaces.

lesson_sections table additions:
- study_space_indexed (BOOLEAN): Indicates if content is indexed for study space search.
- content_embedding (vector): Supports similarity search and content recommendations.

INTEGRATION REQUIREMENTS:

Content Aggregation:
- Ensure all course content (base_classes, paths, lessons, lesson_sections, media assets) is accessible.
- Implement vector embeddings for content similarity and search.
- Enable cross-course content relationship mapping.

AI Integration:
- Enhance Luna context with a course-specific knowledge base.
- Integrate with existing AI infrastructure (agent_sessions, agent_messages).
- Support conversation persistence and context management.

Teacher Tools Adaptation:
- Leverage the existing mind map generator from teacher tools.
- Adapt for student use with course content integration.
- Maintain compatibility with the existing teacher_tool_creations table.

Assessment Integration:
- Link study activities to assessment preparation.
- Integrate with the existing assessment system (assessments, assessment_questions).
- Correlate study analytics with performance.

TECHNICAL CONSIDERATIONS:

Performance:
- Implement efficient indexing for large content volumes.
- Enable vector search capabilities for content similarity.
- Apply caching strategies for frequently accessed content.

Security:
- Enforce RLS policies for student data privacy.
- Apply course-specific access controls.
- Define collaborative feature permissions.

Scalability:
- Support 1000+ concurrent users.
- Provide real-time collaboration infrastructure.
- Optimize performance for mobile devices.

Requirements gathering is complete and the project is ready to proceed to the schema design phase.
</info added on 2025-07-13T15:58:43.591Z>

<info added on 2025-07-13T16:00:43.502Z>
Completed comprehensive analysis of the existing Supabase schema and identified key relationships and integration points for Study Space features:

CORE CONTENT HIERARCHY ANALYSIS:

Primary Content Flow:
organisations → base_classes → paths → lessons → lesson_sections
                    ↓
              lesson_media_assets

User & Access Management:
profiles → rosters → class_instances ← base_classes
    ↓
progress, grades, assessments

KEY EXISTING TABLES FOR INTEGRATION:

1. Content Tables (Primary Integration Points):
- base_classes: Foundation for study spaces (id, name, description, settings, assessment_config)
- paths: Learning progression (id, base_class_id, title, description, order_index)  
- lessons: Individual lessons (id, path_id, base_class_id, title, description, order_index)
- lesson_sections: Granular content (id, lesson_id, title, content JSONB, content_embedding vector)
- lesson_media_assets: Rich media (id, lesson_id, asset_type, content JSONB, svg_content, file_url)

2. User Management Tables:
- profiles: Student info (user_id, username, role, organisation_id, settings JSONB, additional_roles)
- rosters: Class enrollment (id, class_instance_id, profile_id, role, joined_at)
- class_instances: Active classes (id, base_class_id, name, enrollment_code, start_date, end_date)

3. Assessment Integration Tables:
- assessments: Existing assessments (id, base_class_id, lesson_id, path_id, assessment_type)
- assessment_questions: Question bank (id, assessment_id, question_text, question_type, answer_key JSONB)
- student_attempts: Assessment attempts (id, assessment_id, student_id, status, scores)
- student_responses: Individual responses (id, attempt_id, question_id, response_data JSONB)

4. AI & Analytics Tables:
- luna_conversations: Existing AI chats (id, title, persona, user_id, metadata JSONB)
- luna_messages: Chat messages (id, conversation_id, role, content, citations JSONB)
- agent_sessions: AI session tracking (id, user_id, agent_type, context JSONB)
- progress: Learning progress tracking (id, user_id, item_type, item_id, status, progress_percentage)

5. Document & Content Management:
- documents: File storage (id, file_name, storage_path, organisation_id, base_class_id)
- document_chunks: Content indexing (id, document_id, content, embedding vector, metadata JSONB)
- generations: Content generation tracking (id, user_id, asset_type, status, query, response)

EXISTING RELATIONSHIP PATTERNS:

1. Organization Hierarchy:
- All content tied to organisations via organisation_id
- Users belong to organisations via profiles.organisation_id
- RLS policies enforce organization-level data isolation

2. Content Relationships:
- Hierarchical: base_classes → paths → lessons → lesson_sections
- Media assets linked directly to lessons
- Cross-references via JSONB fields in content tables

3. User-Content Relationships:
- Enrollment via rosters table (many-to-many: users ↔ class_instances)
- Progress tracking via progress table (user_id + item_type + item_id)
- Direct ownership via created_by fields

4. AI Integration Patterns:
- Conversation persistence in luna_conversations/luna_messages
- Session tracking in agent_sessions
- Generation tracking in generations table

INTEGRATION OPPORTUNITIES IDENTIFIED:

1. Content Aggregation:
- lesson_sections.content_embedding: Already supports vector search
- documents + document_chunks: Existing content indexing infrastructure
- lesson_media_assets: Rich media already structured in JSONB

2. User Relationship Leverage:
- rosters: Existing enrollment mechanism for study space access
- profiles.settings: Can extend for study preferences
- class_instances: Natural boundary for study space organization

3. AI Infrastructure Reuse:
- luna_conversations: Pattern for study space AI conversations
- agent_sessions: Session management for study activities
- generations: Track AI-generated study content

4. Assessment Integration:
- assessments: Link study activities to assessment preparation
- student_attempts/responses: Correlation with study space usage
- progress: Extend for study space progress tracking

POTENTIAL EXTENSION POINTS:

1. Existing JSONB Fields to Extend:
- profiles.settings: Add study_preferences, default_study_settings
- lesson_sections.content: Already rich content structure
- base_classes.settings: Course-level study space configurations
- class_instances.settings: Instance-specific study settings

2. Existing Vector Fields:
- lesson_sections.content_embedding: Content similarity search
- document_chunks.embedding: Document content search

3. Existing Metadata Fields:
- luna_messages.metadata: Study context information
- progress.last_position: Study session continuation
- generations.query/response: Study-related content generation

NORMALIZATION & PERFORMANCE CONSIDERATIONS:

1. Well-Normalized Structure:
- Clear separation of concerns (users, content, relationships)
- Consistent UUID primary keys
- Proper foreign key relationships
- JSONB for flexible metadata

2. Performance Optimizations Needed:
- Indexes on frequently queried relationships
- Vector search optimization for content_embedding
- Efficient JSONB querying for study data

3. RLS Policy Patterns:
- Organization-level isolation already implemented
- User-specific data access patterns established
- Course enrollment-based access control

RECOMMENDED INTEGRATION STRATEGY:

1. Leverage Existing Patterns:
- Follow established organization → base_class → user relationship model
- Use existing JSONB patterns for flexible study data
- Extend current AI conversation infrastructure

2. Minimal Schema Disruption:
- Add new study space tables without modifying core content tables
- Extend existing tables only with optional columns
- Maintain backward compatibility

3. Consistent Naming & Structure:
- Follow existing naming conventions (snake_case, timestamps)
- Use established patterns for foreign keys and relationships
- Maintain consistent JSONB structure patterns

Analysis complete - schema is well-structured for Study Space integration with minimal disruption to existing functionality.
</info added on 2025-07-13T16:00:43.502Z>

subtasks.description: Test all collaborative features for correct permission enforcement, privacy compliance, and real-time functionality.
subtasks.details: Develop and execute test cases covering group creation, resource sharing, permission changes, privacy settings, and real-time collaboration. Address security and data integrity issues.

tasks.title: Implement API Endpoints for Study Space Features
tasks.description: Develop backend API endpoints for study space functionality, integrated with the current app and Supabase backend.
tasks.details: Create endpoints: GET /api/study-space/{courseId}, POST /api/study-space/notes, GET /api/study-space/content/search, POST /api/study-space/mind-map/generate, POST /api/study-space/ai/chat, GET /api/study-space/analytics, POST /api/study-space/bookmarks. Ensure endpoints are compatible with the existing app structure and authentication.
tasks.testStrategy: Test each endpoint for functionality, security, and performance within the integrated app environment.

subtasks.title: Define Endpoint Requirements and Design
subtasks.description: Gather requirements for each study space feature endpoint, determine data structures, HTTP methods, and path/query parameters. Design the API contract and ensure alignment with business use cases and existing app architecture.
subtasks.details: Collaborate with stakeholders to clarify endpoint purposes, expected inputs/outputs, and relationships. Document endpoint specifications using OpenAPI or similar standards.

subtasks.title: Implement Notes Endpoint
subtasks.description: Develop the backend logic for the notes endpoint, enabling creation, retrieval, updating, and deletion of study notes.
subtasks.details: Integrate with Supabase for data storage. Ensure endpoint supports required operations and adheres to the designed contract.

subtasks.title: Implement Content Search, Mind Map, AI Chat, Analytics, and Bookmarks Endpoints
subtasks.description: Develop backend logic for content search, mind map generation, AI chat, analytics retrieval, and bookmarks management endpoints.
subtasks.details: Implement each endpoint according to the design, ensuring compatibility with Supabase and the existing app structure.

subtasks.title: Integrate Authentication and Authorization
subtasks.description: Add authentication and authorization checks to all endpoints, ensuring only authorized users can access or modify resources.
subtasks.details: Leverage existing authentication mechanisms and implement role-based access controls as needed.

subtasks.title: Implement Input Validation and Error Handling
subtasks.description: Add robust input validation and error handling to all endpoints, returning informative and actionable error messages.
subtasks.details: Validate request payloads, handle missing or invalid data, and return appropriate HTTP status codes and error messages.

subtasks.title: Conduct Integration Testing
subtasks.description: Test all endpoints within the integrated app environment to ensure correct functionality, security, and interoperability.
subtasks.details: Write and execute integration tests covering all endpoints, including edge cases and error scenarios.

subtasks.title: Optimize Performance and Document API
subtasks.description: Optimize endpoint performance and create comprehensive API documentation for developers and stakeholders.
subtasks.details: Profile and improve endpoint response times, implement pagination/filtering where needed, and generate up-to-date API docs using OpenAPI or similar tools.

tasks.title: Develop Personalized Study Guide Generator
tasks.description: Build AI-powered study guide generation tailored to individual needs, integrated with the current app and analytics.
tasks.details: Implement AI content generation pipeline. Integrate learning analytics and template-based guide generation. Support multi-format output (text, visual, audio), ensuring compatibility with the existing app structure.
tasks.testStrategy: Test guide generation, personalization, and output formats within the integrated app.

subtasks.title: Define Requirements and Personalization Logic
subtasks.description: Gather and document requirements for the personalized study guide generator, including user input types, personalization criteria, and logic for tailoring content to individual needs.
subtasks.details: Specify what user data (e.g., performance, preferences, uploaded materials) will drive personalization. Define rules and algorithms for customizing study guides based on this data.

subtasks.title: Design and Implement AI Content Generation Pipeline
subtasks.description: Develop the AI-driven pipeline that analyzes input materials and generates personalized study guide content.
subtasks.details: Set up AI models to extract key concepts, generate questions, and structure content. Ensure the pipeline supports dynamic adaptation based on personalization logic.

subtasks.title: Integrate Analytics for Personalization and Progress Tracking
subtasks.description: Incorporate analytics to track user interactions, learning progress, and guide effectiveness, feeding data back into personalization logic.
subtasks.details: Connect to existing analytics infrastructure. Collect and analyze data such as session duration, quiz results, and content engagement to refine personalization.

subtasks.title: Develop Template-Based Guide Formatting
subtasks.description: Create and implement templates for structuring study guides, ensuring consistency and adaptability for different subjects and formats.
subtasks.details: Design templates for sections like key concepts, MCQs, scenario questions, and answer keys. Enable dynamic population of templates by the AI pipeline.

subtasks.title: Implement Multi-Format Output Support
subtasks.description: Enable the study guide generator to output content in multiple formats, such as text, visual, and audio.
subtasks.details: Develop conversion logic and rendering components for each supported format. Ensure templates and AI-generated content are compatible with all output types.

subtasks.title: Integrate Study Guide Generator with App Structure
subtasks.description: Embed the personalized study guide generator into the existing app, ensuring seamless user experience and compatibility with current components.
subtasks.details: Connect generator interfaces, data flows, and analytics with the app’s backend and frontend. Ensure user authentication, data privacy, and smooth navigation.

subtasks.title: Test Personalization Logic and Output Formats
subtasks.description: Conduct comprehensive testing of the personalization logic and all supported output formats within the integrated app environment.
subtasks.details: Validate that study guides are correctly personalized, formatted, and rendered in all output types. Gather user feedback and iterate as needed.

tasks.title: Implement Interactive Content Exploration
tasks.description: Develop NotebookLM-inspired content interaction and discovery features, integrated into the current app.
tasks.details: Build advanced search and recommendation algorithms. Implement content relationship mapping, user interaction tracking, and personalization engine, leveraging the existing app structure and components.
tasks.testStrategy: Test search, recommendations, content relationships, and personalization within the integrated app.

subtasks.title: Gather Requirements and Design User Experience
subtasks.description: Define detailed requirements for interactive content exploration features and design intuitive user flows, wireframes, and UI components inspired by NotebookLM.
subtasks.details: Engage stakeholders to clarify needs, analyze NotebookLM's interface (sources, chat, studio panels), and create UX prototypes that support seamless switching between managing, reading, and generating content.

subtasks.title: Implement Advanced Search Algorithm
subtasks.description: Develop and integrate advanced search algorithms to enable efficient, context-aware retrieval of content across multiple sources.
subtasks.details: Leverage vector embeddings and full-text search to support large context windows and multimodal content, ensuring fast and relevant results for user queries.

subtasks.title: Develop Recommendation Engine
subtasks.description: Build a recommendation system that suggests relevant content, sources, and study materials based on user activity and content relationships.
subtasks.details: Utilize collaborative filtering, content-based filtering, and user interaction data to generate personalized recommendations within the app.

subtasks.title: Map Content Relationships
subtasks.description: Implement algorithms and data models to identify and visualize relationships between content items, enabling features like interactive mind maps.
subtasks.details: Extract key concepts and connections from uploaded and discovered sources, and generate interactive diagrams to help users explore conceptual links.

subtasks.title: Track User Interactions
subtasks.description: Develop mechanisms to log and analyze user interactions with content, search, recommendations, and relationship maps.
subtasks.details: Capture events such as searches, clicks, note-taking, and navigation to inform personalization and improve system performance.

subtasks.title: Build Personalization Engine
subtasks.description: Create a personalization engine that adapts content exploration, recommendations, and UI elements based on user preferences and behavior.
subtasks.details: Leverage tracked user data and recommendation outputs to tailor the experience, including dynamic content suggestions and adaptive UI components.

subtasks.title: Integrate Features with App Components
subtasks.description: Seamlessly integrate search, recommendations, relationship mapping, interaction tracking, and personalization into the existing app architecture.
subtasks.details: Ensure all new modules work cohesively with current app components, maintaining performance and a unified user experience.

subtasks.title: Conduct Comprehensive Testing
subtasks.description: Test all interactive exploration features, including search, recommendations, relationship mapping, tracking, and personalization, within the integrated app.
subtasks.details: Develop and execute test cases for functionality, usability, performance, and edge cases to ensure robust and reliable user experiences.

tasks.title: Optimize Performance and Scalability
tasks.description: Ensure system performance meets requirements for speed, concurrency, and mobile optimization within the current app.
tasks.details: Implement caching, efficient content retrieval, and scalable AI processing. Optimize for sub-second search, real-time collaboration, and mobile performance, using the existing app structure.
tasks.testStrategy: Load test for concurrent users, measure response times, and test mobile performance within the integrated app.

subtasks.title: Conduct Performance Benchmarking
subtasks.description: Establish baseline metrics for system speed, concurrency, and mobile responsiveness by measuring current app performance under various conditions.
subtasks.details: Define key performance indicators (KPIs) such as response time, throughput, and resource utilization. Use profiling and monitoring tools to gather data on current system performance across desktop and mobile platforms.

subtasks.title: Implement Caching Strategy
subtasks.description: Design and integrate a caching mechanism to reduce redundant data processing and improve response times.
subtasks.details: Select appropriate caching layers (client, server, or CDN). Implement cache invalidation and update policies. Measure impact on performance using benchmarks from subtask 1.

subtasks.title: Optimize Efficient Content Retrieval
subtasks.description: Refactor data access patterns and queries to minimize latency and maximize throughput for content delivery.
subtasks.details: Analyze current data retrieval flows. Implement query optimizations, indexing, and pagination. Leverage caching where possible and validate improvements with updated benchmarks.

subtasks.title: Set Up Scalable AI Processing
subtasks.description: Architect and deploy AI processing infrastructure that scales with user demand and supports concurrent requests efficiently.
subtasks.details: Evaluate current AI workload patterns. Implement horizontal scaling, batching, or asynchronous processing as needed. Integrate with existing backend and monitor resource utilization.

subtasks.title: Optimize Real-Time Collaboration
subtasks.description: Enhance real-time collaboration features for low latency, high concurrency, and seamless user experience.
subtasks.details: Implement efficient data synchronization, conflict resolution algorithms (e.g., OT or CRDTs), and minimize network payloads. Ensure robust offline support and test with multiple concurrent users.

subtasks.title: Tune Mobile Performance
subtasks.description: Identify and address mobile-specific performance bottlenecks to ensure smooth operation on various devices.
subtasks.details: Profile mobile app performance, optimize resource usage, and implement responsive design improvements. Test on a range of devices and network conditions.

subtasks.title: Perform Load and Stress Testing
subtasks.description: Simulate high user loads and stress scenarios to validate system stability, scalability, and performance under peak conditions.
subtasks.details: Develop and execute automated test scripts for concurrent users, spike traffic, and long-duration sessions. Analyze results to identify and address bottlenecks or failure points.

tasks.title: Implement Security and Privacy Controls
tasks.description: Add data protection, access controls, and compliance features, integrated with the current app and Supabase backend.
tasks.details: Encrypt student data at rest and in transit. Implement granular privacy controls, role-based permissions, and FERPA compliance. Conduct security audits, ensuring all features are compatible with the existing app structure.
tasks.testStrategy: Test encryption, access controls, and compliance features within the integrated app.

subtasks.title: Requirements and Compliance Analysis (FERPA, etc.)
subtasks.description: Analyze all relevant legal, regulatory, and institutional requirements for student data protection, focusing on FERPA and any other applicable privacy laws. Identify protected data types, consent protocols, and compliance obligations for the app and Supabase integration.
subtasks.details: Review FERPA guidelines, institutional policies, and third-party vendor obligations. Document all compliance requirements and map them to system features.

subtasks.title: Data Encryption at Rest and in Transit
subtasks.description: Design and implement encryption mechanisms for all sensitive student data, ensuring protection both when stored (at rest) and during transmission (in transit) between the app and Supabase.
subtasks.details: Select appropriate encryption algorithms and key management strategies. Ensure Supabase and app communication uses secure protocols (e.g., TLS).

subtasks.title: Granular Privacy Control Implementation
subtasks.description: Develop privacy controls that allow users (students, parents, admins) to manage access to their data at a granular level, including opt-in/opt-out features and consent management.
subtasks.details: Implement user interfaces and backend logic for privacy settings, consent tracking, and data access requests.

subtasks.title: Role-Based Permission System
subtasks.description: Implement a robust role-based access control (RBAC) system to restrict data access based on user roles (e.g., student, teacher, admin), ensuring only authorized users can view or modify protected records.
subtasks.details: Define roles and permissions, integrate with Supabase authentication, and enforce access policies throughout the app.

subtasks.title: Security Audit and Penetration Testing
subtasks.description: Conduct comprehensive security audits and penetration tests to identify vulnerabilities in encryption, access controls, and privacy features, ensuring compliance with FERPA and institutional standards.
subtasks.details: Engage internal or external security experts to perform audits, document findings, and remediate any issues discovered.

subtasks.title: Integration with App and Supabase
subtasks.description: Integrate all security and privacy controls with the existing app frontend and Supabase backend, ensuring seamless operation and compatibility with current features.
subtasks.details: Update API endpoints, database schemas, and client logic to support new controls. Test integration points for data flow and access enforcement.

subtasks.title: Documentation and Training
subtasks.description: Develop comprehensive documentation and training materials for staff, users, and third-party vendors on new security and privacy features, FERPA obligations, and proper data handling procedures.
subtasks.details: Create user guides, technical documentation, and training modules. Schedule and deliver training sessions as required.

subtasks.title: Compliance Validation
subtasks.description: Validate that all implemented controls and processes meet FERPA and institutional compliance requirements through formal review and, if necessary, external certification.
subtasks.details: Conduct compliance checks, gather evidence, and prepare reports for institutional review or external auditors.

tasks.title: User Testing and Refinement
tasks.description: Conduct user testing, collect feedback, and refine features within the integrated app.
tasks.details: Organize user testing sessions with students. Collect feedback on usability, performance, and feature completeness. Iterate based on findings, ensuring all refinements are made within the current app structure.
tasks.testStrategy: Gather user feedback, analyze metrics, and validate improvements within the integrated app.

subtasks.title: User Testing Session Planning
subtasks.description: Develop a structured plan for user testing sessions, including defining objectives, selecting representative users, choosing testing methods (remote or in-person), preparing test scenarios, and scheduling sessions.
subtasks.details: Establish clear goals, recruit diverse participants, prepare consent forms, and ensure all logistical aspects (venue, tools, moderators) are arranged. Conduct a pilot test to validate the session plan before full rollout.

subtasks.title: Feedback Collection and Analysis
subtasks.description: Collect user feedback during and after testing sessions using surveys, interviews, and observation notes. Analyze the data to extract actionable insights on usability, performance, and feature completeness.
subtasks.details: Use structured forms and recording tools to capture feedback. Categorize and synthesize responses to identify common themes and prioritize issues.

subtasks.title: Usability and Performance Issue Identification
subtasks.description: Review collected feedback and session recordings to identify specific usability and performance issues encountered by users.
subtasks.details: Document all observed problems, categorize them by severity and frequency, and map them to relevant app features or workflows.

subtasks.title: Iterative Refinement and Bug Fixing
subtasks.description: Address identified issues through iterative design and development cycles, implementing refinements and bug fixes within the app.
subtasks.details: Prioritize fixes based on impact and feasibility. Coordinate with development teams to implement changes, and track progress for each identified issue.

subtasks.title: Validation of Improvements
subtasks.description: Conduct follow-up testing to validate that refinements and bug fixes have resolved the original issues and improved the user experience.
subtasks.details: Repeat targeted user tests or deploy surveys to confirm that changes meet user needs and no new issues have been introduced.

tasks.title: Create Basic Study Space Page at /app/(app)/study-space/page.tsx
tasks.description: Develop an initial Study Space page within the existing Next.js app structure, accessible from the student dashboard via the 'Study Space' link.
tasks.details: Create a new folder 'study-space' under /app/(app)/ and add a page.tsx file. Implement a simple React component that displays a placeholder or welcome message for the Study Space. Ensure the page uses the existing app and dashboard layouts by leveraging Next.js layout conventions. Integrate navigation so that the page is accessible from the 'Study Space' link in the student dashboard. Confirm that authentication and access control are consistent with other student dashboard pages. Prepare the component for future integration with Study Space features (e.g., notes, mind maps, analytics) by structuring the code for easy extension. Follow Next.js best practices for page creation and layout integration.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify that navigating to the 'Study Space' link in the student dashboard routes to /study-space and displays the new page. Confirm the page uses the correct layout and is only accessible to authenticated students. Check responsiveness across devices and ensure no layout or navigation regressions. Review code structure for maintainability and readiness for future feature integration.

subtasks.title: Create study-space folder and page.tsx
subtasks.description: Set up the new 'study-space' folder under /app/(app)/ and add a page.tsx file. Ensure the file exports a basic React component as required by Next.js routing conventions.
subtasks.details: Follow Next.js file-system routing by creating the folder structure /app/(app)/study-space/ and adding a page.tsx file that exports a default React component. This will establish the /study-space route in the app.

subtasks.title: Implement placeholder component with correct layout and navigation
subtasks.description: Develop a placeholder or welcome message component for the Study Space page. Ensure it uses the existing app and dashboard layouts, and integrate navigation so the page is accessible from the student dashboard.
subtasks.details: Implement a simple UI in page.tsx, such as a welcome message. Use Next.js layout conventions to ensure the page inherits the correct layout. Update dashboard navigation to include a link to /study-space, verifying the route is accessible.

subtasks.title: Integrate authentication and test accessibility from dashboard
subtasks.description: Ensure the Study Space page is protected by authentication and only accessible to authenticated students. Test navigation from the dashboard and verify layout, responsiveness, and access control.
subtasks.details: Apply the same authentication and access control logic as other student dashboard pages. Test that unauthenticated users are redirected or denied access, and that authenticated students can access the page from the dashboard navigation. Check for layout consistency and responsiveness.

tasks.title: Develop Student-Customized Brainbytes Generator for Study Space
tasks.description: Adapt the existing teacher Brainbytes podcast generation system to allow students to request personalized 3-minute educational audio podcasts based on their class content and prompts within the Study Space.
tasks.details: Extend the current /api/teach/media/generate/podcast endpoint to support student-initiated requests, ensuring it can process prompts such as 'explain photosynthesis in simple terms' or 'help me understand the Civil War battles' using the student's enrolled course materials. Integrate with the Study Space content indexing and retrieval system to source relevant information for each request. Implement prompt handling and context assembly logic to generate concise, age-appropriate scripts tailored to the student's query. Use the Luna AI voice for audio synthesis, leveraging existing TTS infrastructure, and ensure podcasts are hosted and accessible within the Study Space UI. Provide options for students to review, replay, and bookmark generated podcasts. Ensure robust authentication and access control so students only access content from their own courses. Consider adding support for script preview and editing before audio generation, and log podcast requests for analytics and improvement.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify that students can submit topic or question prompts from the Study Space and receive a Luna-hosted 3-minute podcast generated from their class materials. Test with a variety of prompt types and course content to ensure relevance, clarity, and age-appropriateness of generated audio. Confirm that only enrolled course materials are used for each student. Check that podcasts are accessible, replayable, and bookmarkable within the Study Space UI. Validate authentication, access control, and error handling for unsupported prompts or missing content. Conduct usability testing with students to ensure the feature meets educational needs and is easy to use.

subtasks.title: Extend Podcast Generation Endpoint
subtasks.description: Modify the existing /api/teach/media/generate/podcast endpoint to support student-initiated requests.
subtasks.details: Ensure the endpoint can process custom prompts and integrate with the Study Space content indexing system.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify endpoint functionality with various prompts and course materials.

subtasks.title: Integrate with Content Indexing Service
subtasks.description: Connect the podcast generation system with the Study Space content indexing service.
subtasks.details: Use indexed content to source relevant information for student requests.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test integration with sample content and verify accuracy.

subtasks.title: Implement Prompt Handling and Script Generation
subtasks.description: Develop logic to handle student prompts and generate concise, age-appropriate scripts.
subtasks.details: Ensure scripts are tailored to the student's query and course materials.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test script generation with diverse prompts and evaluate clarity.

subtasks.title: Audio Synthesis and Hosting
subtasks.description: Use the Luna AI voice for audio synthesis and host podcasts within the Study Space UI.
subtasks.details: Ensure podcasts are accessible and playable within the Study Space.

subtasks.title: Implement Review, Replay, and Bookmark Features
subtasks.description: Add features for students to review, replay, and bookmark generated podcasts.
subtasks.details: Ensure robust authentication and access control for student content.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test user interaction features and verify access control.
